intro: Stillingia texana var. typica, commonly known as Texas stillingia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, red to orange flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
